name: Humanity Stoked | Michael ien Cohen
bio: Philanthropic movement ❤ DOCUMENTARY FILM with pro skaters & others sharing experiences & thoughts on issues facing humanity | Non-profit brand, merch

social_posts.post_text:
Join us, Sunday, Dec 4th, 4:00 PM, Yonkers, NY for the theatrical screening of Humanity Stoked and live talk at the YoFi Film Festival.
.
Live speakers include @brandon__novak, @jessmargera of CKY, @uncouthyouth of @bronxgirlsskate and @haroldhunterfoundation @charliesamuels of @virginblacktop_film , @raylevier @nicklangmedia and the Producer/Director, Michael Ien Cohen
.
Link in BIO (www.HumanityStoked.com/tickets) for discounted $9.00 tickets and mass transit directions for the NYC Subway and Metro North.
.
If you care about the many important social and environmental issues in this documentary, PLEASE help by reposting and sharing to your story. We are 100% volunteer made and all our revenue goes to charity
.
.
@yofifest

Sunday, Dec 4th, 4:00 PM - Humanity Stoked screening in Yonkers, NY with live talk featuring @brandon__novak @jessmargera @uncouthyouth @raylevier @charliesamuels, Producer/Director Michael Ien Cohen (yours truly) and our first Director of Photography, @nicklangmedia. Discounted tickets for only $9.00 with code Yo22FM and NYC Subway and Metro North directions at link in BIO (HumanityStoked.com/tickets).

.
The reality is that Bam has a massive following of loving and suportitive fans, all wishing him the best, and that warms my heart. I'm one of them, and I've had my own struggles in life too. Sadly, I also know there are haters out there who like putting a negative spin on anything they can, so let me be CRYSTAL FUCKING CLEAR ABOUT SOMETHING:
.
I produced the Humanity Stoked documentary entirely for free, without accepting a dime from anyone, and as a volunteer, just like everyone else who worked on it with me. I'm also giving EVERY FUCKING CENT It generates for me to charity. Not just “profit”…EVERYTHING.
.
There’s nothing in this for me but love and inspiring open conversations for positive change in people’s lives and this world that we all share. I'm lucky to have never suffered from addiction, but I have in fact suffered profoundly from depression in my life. This film both helped me recover, and is also a result of that recovery. From darkness, great things can be born. so never ever give up hope, and never give up hope for those that we love that are suffering with mental health issues. Like addiction, suffering from depression not only affects the individual, it hurts all of the loved ones in our lives. Please be kind and supportive to those that need it. Reach out to them to offer your love and encourage them to seek professional help. 

.
@yofifest
#humanityStoked #jackass #mtv #vivalabam #cky #addiction #recovery #sober #mentalhealthawareness #alcoholism #motivation
#soberliving #drugs #drugaddiction #onedayatatime #aa #alcoholicsanonymous
#rehab #healing #heroinaddict #skateboarding #givingback #movies #filmfestivalseason

Wow!! This Q and A turned out to be a beautiful group therapy session, but more on that in a moment...
.
It was part of an epic screening of Humanity Stoked and a live Q and A session this weekend at the @yofifest in New York, with some of our iconic cast, @brandon__novak
@jessmargera @uncouthyouth
@charliesamuels @raylevier and @nicklangmedia, who was our Director of Photography for the first half of the film. Our other DP, @iangibson.mp4, 
who also happens to be our editor and colorist lives in LA, and could not be there.
.
It's profoundly meaningful to me when the film can touch people and inspire them so deeply as it does. That's especially true at live screenings like it did this weekend, so much, that the audience feels safe enough to accept being vulnerable and love themselves enough to speak up in a room with over 100 strangers and talk about their own battles with depression, fears, addiction and other personal struggles, hopes, and dreams.
.
My love, respect, and gratitude to my amazing cast members, all the dedicated production volunteers and supporters, and of course, all the people who showed up for the screening, some of whom drove up to 5 hours to be there.
.
I was on the call this morning with cast member @charliesamuels, reflecting on the experience, when he said "ya know Michael, that was more like a wonderful group therapy session than like a typical film Q and A, right???"... It sure was my brother!! 
.
Of course, much love, respect, and gratitude to the dedicated staff of the Yonkers Film Festival, including our moderator Dave, who graciously let the session run so long, as people were really engaged in the conversations.
.
.
#humanityStoked
#adiction #filmfestivals #motivation #health #selflove #recovery
#recoveryispossible
#mentalhealth #mentalhealthawareness #sober #addictionawareness #fear #climatechange #femaleempowerment #BLM #hope #givingback

A poignant wish to rest in peace for this beautiful boy, Kaya Rayna Lecour, on his birthday today, and forever more.
.
Kaya’s untimely passing was just before we were to begin filming with him and his dad, Rene, in Cuba in 2018.  It was Kaya’s passing and Rene’s interview there with me about it that profoundly changed what Humanity Stoked would become. I will never take for granted that it was Kaya and Rene’s journey, their beautiful hearts, and sadly, Kaya’s passing that affected me and this film so deeply. It’s a true honor to have Kaya and Rene’s story woven into the narrative of Humanity Stoked and in a way that can help inspire so many others.
.
As someone who has also lost a loved one during the production of this film, albeit my dad, not my son, I know first-hand how it can be tempting to find meaning in the death of a loved one.  I’m not one to believe that things always “happen for a reason”, as if part of a divine plan, as comforting as that may be.  What I know for sure however does bring me peace and comfort; It’s in accepting that we can’t control everything, but when we experience an unbearable loss, it’s up to each of us to make it meaningful if we so choose.  It’s in this way, seeing firsthand how this film continues to resonate with people, touch them on a deeply emotional level, and most importantly, inspires them, that I find some of the comfort, peace, and love that I seek. Soon, Rene and his family will see the film for the first time, and I hope it brings them some level of comfort as well. As for my father, whose birthday is also this month, I know this film is also a way to honor him too, even if there are only a couple of people on this earth that understand how or why it could.
.
For now, I encourage all of you to go to @amigoskatecuba, click on the current post of Kaya, and read the loving tribute Rene wrote for his beautiful boy. Then, when you see your loved ones, please give them a hug and maybe hold on tight just a little longer than you may have otherwise, and let them know how much you love them. Right now, I can’t stop crying, but that’s okay. It’s more than okay actually, and I know so many of you understand. ❤️💔❤️
.
.
#love

I’m honored to announce Humanity Stoked just won BOTH the Jury Prize and Audience Favorite Award at the YoFi Film Festival in New York. When I first conceived of Humanity Stoked, without any filmmaking experience or education, this was far beyond my most optimistic expectations. At times, to ensure I always remain grateful and never take these life-altering experiences for granted, I've reminded myself that "This sort of thing just doesn't happen to a person with my circumstances”, BUT HERE'S THE IMPORTANT PART:
.
As well intentioned as my reminder may have been, it was equally misguided. It’s EXACTLY those types of beliefs that held me back and that keeps any of us from moving forward towards our goals and making our dreams come true. 
.
I'm not here to feed you a line of hippy-dippy bullshit, like "just be positive” and “manifest it", as if it’s that simple, because it's not. Of course staying positive and believing in yourself won't guarantee you'll succeed, but not doing so will almost always guarantee you'll FAIL. More often than not, it guarantees you won't even get started. Let that sink in, because it's profoundly empowering. If you're interested in the backstory, I'll leave the link to the post about it in the bio for a few days. 
.
This is not about accolades for ego’s sake. These accolades help us to secure a respectful distribution deal. From day one, I pledged to give every cent of our revenue (not just “profit”) to charity, so it’s all about inspiring people to think more deeply about so many issues that affect us all. It’s about helping to inspire positive change in each of our lives, and in the world all around us.
.
PLEASE visit www.HumanityStoked.com/scroll to see all the wonderful volunteers and supporters involved. For now, a quick shout out to my core team @iangibson.mp4, @nicklangmedia, @rene.g.slizewski @sonovomastering. Much love, respect, and gratitude to our inspiring cast members who joined me that night for an emotionally engaged talk, @brandon__novak @jessmargera @uncouthyouth @charliesamuels @raylevier & our own @nicklangmedia. 
.
#humanityStoked #filmfestivals #recovery #mentalhealth
#blm #femaleempowerment #fear #documentary

Sound on!! This is my actual house, my family and my heritage. The music is NOT some generic/dramatic "Russian" soundtrack. It's the actual national anthem of Ukraine, so appropriately entitled "Ще не вмерла Україна, lit" ("'Ukraine has not yet perished') and performed by the Metropolitan Opera Orchestra and Chorus in New York City this year. The man in the round rimmed glasses is my Grandfather, Louis Kozolczyk
(Cohen), who emigrated from Ukraine as a child and settled in New York City. Sadly, he passed away just before I was born. 
.
For the last few days here in New York, my kitchen sink wouldn't drain because the line was completely frozen. An 8 hour drive from here, up in Buffalo, NY, over 35 people froze to death this week, many stranded in their cars. An 8 hour flight from here, in Ukraine, thousands of civilians, including children have already died, and untold more may freeze and or starve to death this winter due to Russia's brutal, unjust, and inhumane war. While the term "war" may technically be correct, I dislike it, as there's often a connotation of equality in fault, as if two nations are fighting over their differences. This is a terrorist act, with one sovereign and independent nation unjustly invading and attacking another. The war crimes including the systematic murder, torture, and even rape of innocent civilians is well documented. The latest inhumane act is the destruction of Ukraine's power grid while simultaneously cutting off much of their externally provided energy supply. Untold thousands of families will be left with no way to heat their homes or even feed their families without help.
.
Please visit www.HumanityStoked.com/ukraine for links to support the people of Ukraine. You can also make a 100% tax deductible donation to the www.WhatStopsYou.org foundation for $100.00. The proceeds will go to help families in Ukraine and I'll also send you this special Ukraine commemorative Humanity Stoked deck. 
.
.
.
#ukraine #supportukraine #standwithukraine
#humanitystoked

For Martin Luther King Jr. Day, I'm sharing a clip of Tommy Guerrrero's interview from Humanity Stoked where he's talking about MLK Jr. being a hero of his, and also the childhood inspiration for creating his now iconic "End Racism" board. 
.
I'm wishing everyone a wonderful day today, and with hope that each of us takes a little time to reflect on the past human triumphs and travesties regarding equality in this world, in our communities, and in our own lives. There’s room for all of us to grow with an open heart and mind. It’s also my wish that each of us thinks about the remarkable achievements of MLK Jr., the events that led to this important Federal holiday, and how each of us can continue to allow his legacy to help light the way forward. Much love, respect, and gratitude to a great man, Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. 
.
.
Much love, respect, and gratitude to my friends, @tommyguerrero, and to @chucktrrece for introducing me to Tommy and inviting him into the documentary. 
.
As an aside, it was my conversion with Chuck about our time skating and filming in Cuba together that set the stage for the important conversations I had with people like Chuck, Tommy, and so many other amazing people in the film about racism, colorism, and equality.  In the coming days, I’ll be making some posts about returning to Cuba so stay tuned and stay open. 
.
.
#MLKDay #MLKLegacy #HumanityStoked #BLM #whatstopsyou #endracism #racism #racialequality #justice #activism

Showing love and respect for the skaters in Cuba this week!  As Humanity Stoked continues to screen and win awards at film festivals around the world, something hasn’t been sitting right with me for months. The skaters I filmed with in Cuba that were integral to one of the most emotional parts of the film would NEVER even get to see it. What we did there was motivated purely by goodness, and although it was the antithesis of being opportunistic, it was beginning to feel that way. That was unacceptable to me and I knew I had to get down there for them. 
.
I expressed this to Arturo O’Farrill (@pianitis) last month, and the wheels were put in motion. Arturo is the 7-time Grammy winning Afro-Latin jazz composer I brought to Cuba with me to start filming in 2018. He just invited me to screen the film in Cuba for his cultural envoy of important figures from the worlds of art, music, and philanthropy. Unfortunately, the screening room is too small for the skaters in Cuba who wanted to see it.
.
Thanks to Rene of @amigoskate and Cuba’s own @alvaro_lores of @lindurin.skate.school, @is_ari_steph, and Ariel of the @lamarcabodyarthavana tattoo studio in Havana, we’ll be doing a 2nd, exclusively for the skaters, and of course, 100% free! I’m also bringing down medical supplies, musical supplies, and skate merch to donate, because very often, it’s the only way these kids can obtain it. The embargo makes life oppressive there, so it’s an honor and a privilege to show my love, respect and gratitude to the community of skaters there!
.
A special thanks for two friends of mine who helped make these donated goods possible. Cast member @stevevandoren of @vans and Shelly Tygielski, the @mindfullskatergirl herself and her big hearted “Pandemic of Love” followers. Thank you all so much!! A special shout out to the Cartel Skate Shop (@cartelstorefi) in Tempere, Finland for the "thrasher" hoodie I'm wearing, and the 'thrasher' skateboard they literally pulled off the skate shop wall for me to fly back with. It's now proudly on the wall here in my studio! A bigger post about our special experience in Tempere, Finland coming soon! 
.
#cuba #philanthropy #givingback #smugglersblues

let me break this tattoo post down in 3 steps for ya'll 

1) I was born in Brooklyn, NY in 1966, and skateboarding became a part of my life just 6 years later, at 6 years old (that repetition, a loving nod to my friend @r.barbee). Without my life-long love of skating, I could never have conceived of Humanity Stoked. The film helped me out of my head space while still in the midst of a terrible depression. 

2)  One year later, the tragic passing of Kaya Lecour, Kaya's love of helping kids in Cuba, his father Rene's continuation of that love through @amigoskatecuba, and the deeply emotional experience of filming in Cuba with Rene, inspired me to change the narrative of my film, sending it upwards on a beautiful path that became profoundly meaningful to so many people around the world.
.
3) In turn, the film changed my life! The journey of producing & directing it transformed me into a humatrian and a filmmaker, both of which I had seen as my purpose since I was 13 years old, but let it remain a maladaptive daydream due to fears of uncertainty. I let those fears stop me from even trying to make my dreams come true for decades. So, allow me to be your cautionary tale, for that is an honor. 
.
Now, after 5 years years of living my dreams and returning to Cuba to do a free screening for the skaters at the iconic @lamarcabodyarthavana tattoo shop and art gallery in old Havana, I return to New York with this deeply meaningful tattoo, serving as a way for me to honor it ALL.
.
The honor also includes my love of Cuba. I've visited over 25 countries so far, and among them, I have found there to be a love, a warmth, a resiliency, a generosity, a style, and a vibe that is unique to that special place. Ironically, while tattoos are considered permanent, it's also a reminder for me not to take things in life for granted, for everything here on earth, ourselves and the planet itself included, is ephemeral. While we're all here however, this is my expression of love, respect, and gratitude ~ Michael ien Cohen 
.
.
A special thanks to @lamarcabodyarthavana @Robertoramosmori and @asc86_ink for refusing to accept payment for my tattoo and for hosting that special free screening.

Congratulations to @humanitystoked on winning 7 film festival awards in 6 different countries so far and still going strong! 🙌🏽♥️🛹 

Was happy to become a part of this meaningful documentary along with some legends like @tonyhawk @thetonyalva1957 @nyjah @rob_machado @stevevandoren @christianhosoi @chriscobracole @bam__margera @brandon__novak and the conversation focused on some of the issues that affect humanity’s ability to move forward - fear, depression, addiction, education, activism, philanthropy, racism, sexism, homophobia, and the environment. 🛹🎥🎞️ 

Follow @HumanityStoked for upcoming announcements for screenings in cities around the world and streaming announcements. 

🙌🏽🎥🎞️🛹

Не оставила почему-то ничего в ленте с красной дорожки кинофестиваля в Newport Beach (Калифорния), где проходила премьера американского документального фильма, в котором я снялась полтора года назад вместе с Тони Хоук, Бэмом Марджерой, Стиво, Найджа Хьюстоном, Робом Мачада, Крисом Хосой и другими легендами скейтбординга и сёрфинга @tonyhawk @thetonyalva1957 @nyjah @rob_machado @stevevandoren @brandon__novak @christianhosoi @chriscobracole, как будто нет ничего особенного в том, что теперь можно рассмотреть поры на моём лице на огромных экранах американских кинотеатров)) А скоро и по всему миру - фильм только что завоевал 7-ую премию в 6 разных странах. 🛹🎥🎞️ 

Для меня было честью стать частью этого важного документального фильма о преодолении страхов, депрессии, зависимости, а также гомофобии, филантропии, активизме, расизме и сексизме. 🙌🏽🎥🎞️

P.S.: Поскольку я не была бы там без моего английского, напомню, что скоро стартует новый поток бесплатного ‼️ пробного периода моего курса по англ.яз - проходите по ссылке в шапке профиля @english_spanish_alyonaalekhina 🌊
‼️Теперь и новый курс 3.0‼️

Who doesn’t love surprises? I’m skating through terminal 4 at JFK Airport this morning at 6:00 AM  for my flight to Los Angeles when I hear “MICHAEL!” I step off my board to find out it’s the one and only @brianandersonsb
.
It’s funny when you’re skating on a Humanity Stoked deck with a cast member’s name printed on it, and lo and behold, they magically appear before you. It’s like skating on Aladdin’s lamp 😉 
.
I’m so fortunate for Brian having become a dear friend of mine. Beyond an iconic pro skater, he’s one of the most kind, open, loving, empathetic, and supportive men I know. His willingness to have been so open, raw, honest, and vulnerable with me in his interview for Humanity Stoked is something I will forever be grateful for. Thank you, Brian!
.
This chance meeting at 6:00 AM today reminds me of just how many serendipitous encounters, connections, and events that have occurred since I conceived of this film in 2017, that actually made its completion possible. Many of you know some of the stories, but few of you know them all.
.
Some are so amazingly serendipitous, they're literally difficult to believe. At some of the screening Q and A sessions, I tell serendipitous stories about @neildegrassetyson @tonyhawk @jeffclark @hamishbrewer @stevevandoren @winglam and @iangibson.mp4.... Some get huge laughs and even rounds of applause, and I never take a single one for granted. 
.
I’ll be in LA to work on the final sound mix tweaks with @iangibson.mp4 @sonovomastering and @rene.g.slizewski
.
We’ve got some cool announcements coming up, so be sure to follow us for the news! 
.
Other photos: 2) The day I first met Brian on the morning of his interview 3) Red carpet at the USA primer of Humanity Stoked at the SoHo International film Festival in NYC with @brianandersonSB @iangibson.mp4 myself @chucktreece and @hamishbrewer 4) Serendipitously bumping into @nyjah on the street my last visit to LA
.
.
#humanitystoked #serendipity #coincidence #skateboarding #LGBTQ #JFK #brianandrson #nyjah #skateboarding

CAN’T MAKE THIS UP 🤙 Serendipity strikes at the Atlanta Docufest ’23. 
.
I planned on doing this screening alone yesterday because none of my 70+ cast members lives anywhere near Georgia. On the flight down however, I got a text from Philadelphia's own @chucktreece, who happened to glance our IG story. Coincidentally, he was actually in Atlanta recording a new album with the talented singer/songwriter @rosey5d, and they were stoked to roll up to the screening!!! (pic 3) but there’s more…
.
The next day, I'm skating around the @poncecitymarket before our screening and a stranger (@xlgh1157x) calls me out. It turns out this cool couple, Lawrence & Kristen, and their two cool kids (pic 2) were killing time before the screening and recognized my skateboard. He told me that out of the entire cast of 70+ people, his FAVORITE was Chuck Treece!!!. He knew Chuck was the first black man to make the cover a skateboard magazine (@thrashermag 1984), how he played with the iconic band @badbrainsofficial, and @mcrad, which chuck founded. He told me his own band used to do a cover of McRad's “Weakness” (check it on Spotify!). Most importantly, he told me he never had the chance to meet Chuck in person... I’m like “Dude, you're not gonna believe this” hahaha 
.
It was so cool to be able to introduce them to one another at the screening after all these years!!
.
Making serendipitous connections like this is just the one of countless honors I have been blessed with since conceiving of this film back in 2017. I'm beyond grateful for every single one!
.
A special shout out to Imani @bellbalboa (pic #1) of the cool @thedarwinhotel (pic 1 & 4 ) for sponsoring my trip down here and making it possible.
.
MAD RESPECT for the late/great congressman & human being, @repjohnlewis, (pic 1 & 5) whose hotel mural Imani asked me to photograph her in front of with my skateboard. If you don't know who John Lewis was, read his wiki page as a start 💪🏿❤️💪🏿
.
Lastly, thanks to the @atlantafilmseries for selecting @humanitystoked (ONE OF ONLY 13 FEATURE LENGTH DOCS OUT OF 379 SUBMITTED!) and putting on a great documentary film festival!
.
#documentary #filmfestival #skateboarding #repjohnlewis

WOW!! It’s hard to wrap my head around this, especially considering the most humble and unlikely start to filmmaking ever imaginable.
.
I'm honored to announce that Humanity Stoked just won its 11th film festival at the Atlanta Docufest 2023, and I’m overwhelmed with gratitude.
.
This win is rather special to me, as our 10 previous wins around the world was for Best Feature Documentary, but this one, our 11th , was my first for Best Director. Astonishingly to me, nearly 400 feature length documentary films were submitted to the festival, of which ONLY 13 were selected, so just making their official selection was an honor!
I am truly amazed, humbled, and profoundly grateful! Thank you all!!!
.
.
*** UPCOMING THEATRICAL SCREENINGS ***

*** Tickets at HumanityStoked.com/tickets (link in bio) ***
.
March 25th    Cape Town, South Africa – live talk at the special closing night screening and party
.
March 29th   Sarasota, Florida, USA – Cast member, artist, @chris_dyer will be joining me for the live talk
.
Lastly, I filmed a one-minute clip about how this film was made, with an emphasis on gratitude, to show respect, and to give thanks, so I encourage you all to watch it. It’s the 5th slide of this post.
.
Be sure to follow us here for upcoming announcements about additional in-person theatrical screenings across the USA and around the world, as well as distribution announcements! Big things are coming 😊
.
Much love, respect, and gratitude,

Michael Ien Cohen
Producer/Director
.
.
Special thanks for the talented photographers for supporting Humanity Stoked by granting us a free license to use their photos. Much love to everyone!
Photo credits: Peggy Oki | Matt Dayka Photography, Neil deGrasse Tyson | Christopher Cassidy, Tony Hawk | Anton Corbijn, Kava Vasquez | Jordana Bermúdez, Lizzie Armanto | Dana Trippe, Brian Anderson | Samuel McGuire.com, Shepard Fairey | Gilles Toucas
.
.
.
.

.
.

Sometimes it takes an ASS to remind us not to take ourselves too seriously. There's a time and a place for everything, including every state of being. In the full episode, I spoke about living in fear and choosing to "LIVE VS. DIE". I've been vocal about my history with depression, both here and in the documentary, so people have asked me if I meant that figuratively, or in the literal sense.
.
The more important question is what it means to you.  What are the practical implications for us all? What are we doing with our precious time...day to day, and year to year, because we are all ephemeral. 
.
I'm not one of those  pontificating, self-appointed Guru's, and I'm not here to tell you all that you're not "living fully", not growing enough, nor "living with purpose"...Hell no!  Having said that however, those WERE judgments I made on MYSELF, and rightfully so, because I knew for decades it was true for ME. I knew I needed more, even a child, truly. Sadly, despite that awareness, I let fears of uncertainty hold me back for most of my life. 
.
but despite so many reminders, I failed to break free from my fears, and start fully living my drreams until I turned 50. I remember hearing the Verve song "Bitter Sweet Symphony" for the first time at 30 years old, and damn!!!...that first verse hit me like a ton of bricks. ("Cause it's a bittersweet symphony, that's life...tryna make ends meet, you're a slave to money...THEN YOU DIE"). 
.
I thought to myself, MY GOD, THIS CAN'T BE WHAT LIFE IS ALL ABOUT, yet I still let another 26 years pass before trying to make my dreams come true. 
.
Each day, we all get one day closer to dying, but don't think of it as sad :) Think of it as a wake-up call and as a reminder not to let another day get away from you. 
.
Much love, respect, and gratitude to you all... Michael
.
.
Watch this full "Shredding the Gnar" podcast episode with me and @_steve_shooter in the links menu on www.HumanityStoked.com (link in BIO) 
.
.
.
#nofear #live #life #manifist #chooselife #depression #skateboarding #love #bethechange #surfing
#Capetown #southafrica

BIG CONGRATS to our entire team on these fantastic first two movie reviews! 
.
Normally, I try and write meaningful posts, but today, I’m happy to let Tim Molloy, editor of MovieMaker Magazine and R.C. Samo, editor of Fanboy Nation do the talking for me 😊 
.
“Michael Ien Cohen’s ‘Humanity Stoked‘ makes us feel as if we are a part of his journey in overcoming fear through the world of skateboarding and makes you want to stand up to whatever we have lurking in our own shadows.
.
“he was able to tell a story in a way that some documentarians have not been able to pull off in a 20 plus year career.”
.
.
~ R.C. Samo, Fanboy Nation
.
.
“The root of all problems, the film argues: is fear. Fear of change, fear of the unfamiliar, fear of people you perceive as strange. The secret to progress is confronting fear.  It encourages all of us to talk about our fears, openly, and how we might get past them, and to invite everyone to the table, no matter their background.”
.
“Artist Shephard Fairey, neuroscientist Andrew Huberman and astrophysicist Neil de Grasse Tyson are among those who talk about their own resistance to change, and certainty that humankind can break through to a brighter future if we can take the leap, like a skater falling into a half pipe. There will be injuries. They will be worth it.”
.
“… the film locks into an irresistible thesis that suggests skaters are the perfect people to address our crises.”

“…Proof that we can do big things if we conquer our fears!”
.
.
~ Tim Molloy, MovieMaker Magazine
.
.

Read full reviews via HumanityStoked.com/reviews (link in bio)

Summer screening schedule and tickets at HumanityStoked.com/tickets (link in bio)

Official Thertical Trailer at HumanityStoked.com (link in bio)
.
.

I’m profoundly honored to announce our 13th official film festival win, along with our new official movie poster revision! Our 13th win was for “Best Feature Film” at the incredible @wavescapesa film festival in Cape Town, South Africa! It was one of my favorite film festival experiences ever, and I’ll be posting about it next! For those of you interested in graphic design, you can see what I revised in the movie poster and why in the annotated photo in this post. 
.
A special shout out to my talented DP, Editor and Colorist, @iangibson.mp4 and another talented filmmaker and designer, @sleberecht.  Some of the tweaks to the movie poster were inspired by a fun convo the three of us had while on a filmmaker’s cruise at the prestigious Newport Beach Film Festival @newportbeachfilmfest. It was the California premier of both Humanity Stoked and Jurassic Punk.  By the way, check out Scott’s fantastic documentary, Jurassic Punk. I loved it!!
.
Special thanks to the talented photographers for supporting Humanity Stoked by granting us a free license to use their iconic photos. Much love to everyone!

Movie Poster Photo credits: Peggy Oki | Dylan Catherina, Neil deGrasse Tyson | Christopher Cassidy, Tony Hawk | Anton Corbijn, Kava Vasquez | Scott B Sandler, Lizzie Armanto | Dana Trippe, Brian Anderson | Samuel McGuire.com, Shepard Fairey | Gilles Toucas. Also thanks to the iconic Hublot watch company
.
.
.

Pride "month"? Read on, but first a heads up: Charity screening Sat Night, July 15th, Huntington, Long Island NY & live talk with myself, @brianandersonsb @uncouthyouth & @raylevier .Other screenings in NY and California in July - Info & tix at HumanityStoked.com/tickets (link in bio)
.
As for pride month being over, I posted this clip from the doc last year, but I thought about it more deeply today. The post was one in a sea of supportive LGBTQ+ posts last June. Most were positive, but a smaller,  disturbing number of posts we're anti-LGBTQ+. The larger point is that while an entire pride month is helpful, in many parts of the USA, and around the world, people in the LGTBQ+ community continue to live in a state of shame, hate, fear, and even physical danger, all year. People are still forced to live a lie, pretending they're not gay out of fear of getting ostracized by their own friends and family. Or worse, being bullied, beat up, fired, jailed, and even murdered. Sadly, it can lead to people living with so much pain, despair and hopelessness, that they take their own lives. 
.
I am under no illusion that my film is going to solve the world's problems, but if I can help play even a tiny part in shining a light on so many important issues to inspire more open, honest, deeper thinking and helpful conversations,  then that's an honor. I'm grateful for the wonderful cast for being so open, honest, and vulnerable with me on camera. I hope you can join us for a screening of Humanity Stoked and live talk to follow Sat, July 15th in Huntington, Long Island NY. Additional screenings in San Francisco, CA, and in NY, Thursday July 20th in Bellmore, Long Island NY, and Friday, July 29th in Montauk, Long Island NY. Info & tickets at HumanityStoked.com/tickets
.
Special thanks to @tonyhawk, @tommyguerrero, @brianandersonsb. Special thanks to for the donated the b-roll to @girlskateboards, @danielpolicelli, @transworldskate @tyevans @thrashermag @nikesb @girlskateboards @antihero18 and @nymag
.

Sat July 15th Huntington (long Island), NY - join @brianandersonsb, myself, @uncouthyouth & @raylevier for a special charity screening of Humanity Stoked followed by a live Q and A in Huntington, NY. Join @raylevier and myself at 2nd screening in Bellmore (Long Island), NY on July 20th.  Info and advance tickets available at HumanityStoked.com/tickets (link in BIO).
.
As for the film, these are Brian Anderson’s own words:
"This is a film mostly about people overcoming fear and navigating your surroundings in this life. People overcoming injuries both physical and mental. Racism, xenophobia, climate change, transphobia, depression, love & hate, joy and recovery! (To name a few) Peoples struggles with being who they want to be and who they are meant to be. All while navigating the pressure of modern day pop culture’s sort of CCTV if you will
.
I am very proud to be part of a film which to me is so well rounded with diverse stories from all walks & rolls of life. I left feeling re inspired about the future when Michael first showed it to me last winter. Thank you to everyone who shared their time and intimate stories about how they got to where they are in life today. I believe the more we as humans chose to share our experiences with each other in the right setting such as this film, the more we learn to hopefully make the next days of our lives a little brighter.”
.
This film is volunteer made without funding with all proceeds/revenue for charity. I’m so very proud of Michael for fulfilling his lifelong dream of making SOME kind of film in his lifetime. He chose to make this one, and I think it’s quite beneficial to the planet and all of us living here together. ✌️❤️🛹🌍✨"
.

... thank you @brianandersonsb !!
Thank you for making my film and my life better by being a part of both!

Michael Ien Cohen
Producer/Director
Humanity Stoked
.
HumanityStoked.com/tickets

.

I'm honored to announce that Humanity Stoked just won its 15th & 16th film festival award in San Francisco this week at the iconic San Francisco Frozen Film Festival!
.
In its 18th year, this epic rooftop festival was recently voted one of the “Top 25 Coolest Film Festival’s in the World” by Moviemaker Magazine. 
.
Humanity Stoked won the festival’s “Best Feature Documentary” prize (and also a 2nd prize for best film in the surf/skate category!). As I’ve said many times before, especially considering such a humble and unlikely start to filmmaking ever imaginable, I am simply overwhelmed with gratitude. I have so much love and heartfelt appreciation for my cast, crew, the hundreds of volunteers and supporters, the countless social media accounts that like, comment, and share our posts and stories, and of course, all the judges and attendees at the San Francisco Frozen Film Festival. A big congrats to all the other category winners and talented filmmakers that made the official selection. 
.
As a reminder, Humanity Stoked is entirely volunteer-produced, and all its revenue in perpetuity is for charity at @whatstopsyou
.
.
*** WE HAVE TWO UPCOMING THEATRICAL SCREENINGS ON LONG ISLAND NEW YORK: Bellmore, NY July 20th at the @longislandfilmexpo and Montauk, NY July 24th at the @montaukfilmfestival.
*** Tickets at HumanityStoked.com/tickets (link in bio) ***
.
Be sure to follow us here for upcoming announcements about additional in-person theatrical screenings across the USA and around the world, as well as distribution announcements! Big things are coming 😊
.
Much love, respect, and gratitude,
.
Michael Ien Cohen
Producer/Director
.
BTW, for those of you who wonder why the festival has “frozen” in its name,  It’s a playful reference to the San Francisco weather and a respectful nod to my absolute favorite humorist/writers of all time, Samuel Clemens (AKA Mark Twain), who famously wrote, “The coldest winter I ever spent was my summer in San Francisco.”
.
.
.
.

THIS!!!! THIS IS WHY!!!! ❤️❤️

This is why I founded my children's charity, the WhatStopsYou.org Foundation, and it’s one of the reasons I created the Humanity Stoked documentary. In order to help people escape the trap of living a fear-based life, the goal is to inspire people to think more deeply about the origins and consequences of fear, as well as the many social, interpersonal, and environmental issues fear creates and exacerbates.
.
These issues include, xenophobia, homophobia, racism, gender inequality, depression, addiction & recovery, and the importance of art, music, and culture exposure in public education.
.
Last but not least, is environmental stewardship, because regardless of our social, political, or religious affiliations, we all have only one planet to share. So people, we better reach a consensus on how to care for it, and how to peacefully coexist on it…TOGETHER.  These issues are what Humanity Stoked is all about. 
.
If you're interested in how to help children and teachers better understand fear and how not to let it hold them back in life, visit my non-profit foundation at www.WhatStopsYou.org. (@whatstopsyou)
.
Lastly, I encourage you to check out the rest of this podcast with @chris_dyer. Chris is an iconic artist/muralist/podcaster with hundreds of thousands of fans around the world! I’m honored Chris came to Cuba with me in 2018 to honor Kaya Lecour of @amigoskatecuba for the Humanity Stoked documentary.
.
Most recently, my friend Chris joined me for a film screening and live talk at the Florida premier of Humanity Stoked at the Sarasota Film Festival. It was wonderful staying with Chris and @paulinacasatiart at their home in Florida and sitting down with him as guest on the 69th episode of “Chris Dyer’s Creative Friends” Podcast. It was a deep dive episode, which we pulled this clip from. Check it out!! 
.
Links to watch/listen on YouTube, Spotify, Apple, and Anchor are in the bio (or at www.HumanityStoked.com/podcasts). 

.
.

.
.

I LOVE IT when people watch Humanity Stoked and realize the common thread across all the important topics isn’t actually skateboarding, it’s FEAR. 
.
The reality is that the various forms of xenophobia, inequality, personal stagnation, environmental issues, depression, addiction, and more that we openly discuss in the film are often caused by FEAR. More importantly, they are almost always exacerbated by FEAR. 
.
And who better in this iconic cast of 70+ iconic pro skaters, scientists, artists, educators, activists, and musicians to not only understand this on a psychological level, and even more deeply, at the neurological level, then the brilliant Andrew Huberman @hubermanlab.  Andrew, so much love and gratitude for being a part of this important and inspiring documentary. 
.
NOW is your chance to see this film live, Nov 12th in San Diego, CA and meet some of the iconic cast in-person as part of the Coronado island Film Festival. Your $15.00 movie ticket price includes a @vans / @wahoosfishtaco pre-party with @stevevandoren on BBQ and @Wahooawing serving @wahoosfishtaco.  Also, meet cast members @lizziearmanto @thetonyalva1957 & @peggyoki
.
Live talk / Q&A to follow each with the filmmakers, Michael ien Cohen and @iangibson.mp4, and cast members Lizzie Armanto, Tony Alva and Peggy Oki
.

Director’s note: I’m a Brooklyn Born, life-long New Yorker, and began skating at 7 years old in 1974. In 1977 however, I moved to southern California for two formative years. At 10 years old, I saw iconic photos of @thetonyalva1957 doing “insane things”, airing out of pools, which was something I never imagined anyone would or could ever do. The photos were by @glenefriedman, and it was UNFATHOMABLE, even as recently as 6 years ago, that I would become a film Producer and Director one day, and that both of these human beings, plus 70 others icons would be in a film I made. I am overwhelmed with gratitude. 
.
Special thanks to the beautiful singer/songwriter/skater/cast member…@jose.gonz.music for lending the acoustic version of his hit song “line of Fire” to this clip and the official Humanity Stoked soundtrack. 
.

Philanthropic movement ❤ DOCUMENTARY FILM with pro skaters & others sharing experiences & thoughts on issues facing humanity | Non-profit brand, merch
